text: Jesús Mosterín (1941 – 4 October 2017) was a Spanish philosopher and a thinker of broad spectrum, often at the frontier between science and philosophy. He was born in Bilbao, Spain. His works are based off Bertrand Russell’s History of Western Philosophy, whose foreword he composed,Foreword (Prólogo) by Mosterín to Bertrand Russell, Historia de la filosofía occidental, Madrid: Espasa Calpe, 1994. Some of the books of the series are devoted, for example, to Archaic thought,Mosterín, Jesús (2006). “El pensamiento arcaico”. AristotleMosterín, Jesús (2006). Aristóteles. and the philosophy of India.Mosterín, Jesús (2006). India: Historia del Pensamiento. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1993. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Spanish writers Category:Spanish philosophers Category:People from Bilbao Category:Members of Academia Europaea
